description: The Congress criticized Prime Minister Modi's new scheme providing Rs 10,000 to 75 lakh women in poll-bound Bihar, labeling it "vote revdi" and "vote chori." Congress leader Jairam Ramesh accused Modi of hypocrisy, highlighting his previous criticism of Karnataka's similar welfare scheme while now implementing one himself just before elections.

Asia Cup: 'How much time?' PCB chief drops cryptic post ahead of IND vs PAK final
description: PCB chairman Mohsin Naqvi posted a cryptic social media message. This sparked controversy before the Asia Cup final. India's Suryakumar Yadav faced an ICC fine. Pakistan's Haris Rauf also received a penalty. Naqvi offered to pay Rauf's fine. He shared a Ronaldo video resembling Rauf's gesture. Off-field issues now overshadow the final match.

Delhi BMW accident case: Accused Gaganpreet Kaur gets bail; court flays paramedics at scene
description: Delhi's Patiala court granted bail to Gaganpreet Kaur in the BMW accident case that tragically killed a finance ministry official. However, the court sharply questioned an ambulance's conduct, which arrived at the scene but left within 30 seconds without transporting the injured. It asked if this constituted medical negligence, highlighting the ambulance's duty to assist accident victims.

description: Former India spinner Sunil Joshi is appointed as the new spin bowling coach at the BCCI Centre of Excellence, effective October 1. Bringing extensive coaching experience, he will collaborate with CoE Head VVS Laxman to identify, nurture, and groom spin talent across all age groups, including current Indian team members, replacing Sairaj Bahutale.

description: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old Sikh woman, detailed her distressing deportation from the US after three decades, alleging severe mistreatment by ICE, including being denied a bed despite double knee replacements. Her unsuccessful appeals preceded her repatriation.

description: TVK chief Vijay campaigned in Namakkal, accusing DMK of secret dealings with BJP and vowing to face them in 2026. He promised stringent measures against kidney theft, linking it to a DMK MLA's hospital and the government's failure to uplift weavers, whose plight drives such heinous acts.

'Lasted for hours': Denmark reports new drone sightings over biggest military base
description: Danish police confirmed fresh drone sightings over Karup Airbase, Denmark's largest military base, marking the latest in a series of aerial intrusions. These incidents, which have also affected other critical infrastructure, are being investigated as a possible "hybrid attack" on the country. Authorities are treating the situation with caution amid rising regional tensions.

World Championships: Historic! 18-year-old Sheetal Devi clinches gold
description: Sheetal Devi, an 18-year-old armless Indian archer, made history by winning gold in the women's compound individual category at the Para World Archery Championship, defeating world No.1 Oznur Cure Girdi. This marked her third medal, adding to a mixed team bronze and a women's open team silver, showcasing her unique technique using feet and chin.

description: Prime Minister Modi inaugurated projects worth over Rs 60,000 crore in Odisha. BSNL's indigenous 4G network launched, a major telecom milestone. Over 97,500 4G towers were commissioned across multiple states. Two semiconductor units received approval for Odisha. Railway, healthcare, and education sectors also saw new initiatives. The government highlighted its vision for self-reliance.

description: Ladakh DGP briefed on the September 24 violence, where 17 CRPF personnel and over 70 civilians were injured during protests. He accused environmental activist Sonam Wangchuk of sabotaging ongoing government discussions with local bodies regarding 6th Schedule status and statehood, leading to the violent clashes and property damage.

Mid-air panic: Passenger held at Mumbai airport for smoking on flight from Phuket
description: A 25-year-old passenger, Bhavya Gautam Jain, was arrested at Mumbai airport for allegedly smoking in a flight lavatory during a Phuket-Mumbai flight on Friday night. The incident caused panic among passengers, leading to Jain's booking under the Aircraft Act, as smoking is strictly prohibited on all flights.

'Left no chance to loot people': PM Modi attacks Congress in Odisha
description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi, addressing a public meeting in Odisha, accused the Congress of looting people and taxing low-income groups, contrasting it with BJP's relief efforts like raising income tax limits and reducing GST. He launched development projects worth over Rs 60,000 crore, emphasising Odisha's progress under a 'double-engine' government and the 'Atmanirbhar Bharat' vision.

'I Love Muhammad' row: UP cleric Tauqeer Raza Khan detained after protest turns violent
description: Police detained Tauqeer Raza Khan, chief of Ittehad-e-Millat Council, after a violent clash erupted in Bareilly following his call for an 'I Love Muhammad' protest. Authorities cited a planned conspiracy and Section 163 BNSS, while Raza claimed house arrest and police atrocities. The controversy stems from an FIR against displaying 'I Love Muhammad' boards, sparking wider protests and national debate.

description: BRICS foreign ministers condemned Trump-era US tariffs as trade-restrictive actions disrupting global supply chains and economic stability. Meeting on the sidelines of UNGA80, the expanded group, including new members, also pushed for reforms in global institutions like the UN Security Council and greater representation for developing nations, underscoring their growing influence.

title: Deadly clash in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa: 17 killed in Pakistan-TTP gunfight
description: Seventeen Tehreek-e-Taliban Pakistan (TTP) militants were killed in a joint operation by security forces in Khyber Pakhtunkhwa's Karak district after they opened fire, injuring three personnel. A curfew was imposed for further operations. Separately, an airstrike reportedly killed 23 civilians, including women and children, in the same province, though no official statement has been issued.

title: Chia deeds with curd: Why it is the ultimate breakfast recommended by experts
description: Busy mornings often lead to skipped breakfasts, but experts suggest overnight solutions like chia seeds with curd and berries. These tiny seeds, packed with protein, fiber, and omega-3s, offer immense health benefits from improved digestion to stable blood sugar.

'I Love Muhammad' row: What sparked violent protests in UP’s Bareilly? 10 things to know
description: Protests over "I Love Muhammad" posters turned violent in Uttar Pradesh. Bareilly witnessed stone-pelting and vehicle vandalism after Friday prayers. Police used lathi charge and tear gas to disperse crowds. Chief Minister Yogi Adityanath ordered strict action against miscreants. Religious and political leaders appealed for calm. The unrest spread to several other states. Authorities ensured heightened security for upcoming festivals.

'He stayed the same': Gisele Bündchen reveals why she left Leonardo DiCaprio
description: Gisele Bundchen, post-divorce from Tom Brady, reflects on her past high-profile relationship with Leonardo DiCaprio, revealing it ended due to differing life paths. She also recalls meeting Brady, whom she married in 2009 before their 2022 divorce. Bundchen now lives a comfortable life with her new boyfriend, Joaquim Valente.

title: Accenture fired 11,000+ employees; CEO Julie Sweet warns, exit or upgrade
description: Accenture laid off over 11,000 employees globally in three months, citing rapid AI adoption and slowing corporate demand. These cuts are part of an $865 million restructuring, with more exits anticipated as the company aligns its workforce with AI-driven solutions and invests in agentic AI training. Despite the layoffs, Accenture reported a 7% revenue increase.

title: 'They didn’t want a Black character': Gabrielle Union on film rejection
description: Gabrielle Union, wife of Dwyane Wade, recently spoke about facing discrimination in Hollywood. She revealed being rejected for a role due to her ethnicity. Union wanted to be in 'Sugar and Spice' but was turned down. She also discussed beauty standards and how they affected her career. Despite challenges, Union has achieved success. Her marriage with Wade inspires many.

title: Billionaire Silicon Valley investor says US' H-1B visa policy could backfire
description: Michael Moritz, a prominent Silicon Valley investor, has strongly condemned President Trump's $100,000 H-1B visa fee, arguing it will stifle innovation and drive talent overseas. He believes the policy reflects a misunderstanding of the factors driving American tech success. Moritz suggests expanding the H-1B program and offering citizenship to STEM PhD graduates instead.

title: Top H‑1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others; check list
description: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.
